items.title: BBC News app
items.summary: Top stories, breaking news, live reporting, and follow news topics that match your interests

items.title: Trump urges EU to impose 100% tariffs on China, India to pressure Putin, sources say
items.summary: Donald Trump also encouraged the European Union to slap India with similarly expansive tariffs.

items.title: When AIADMK witnessed parallel general council meetings 28 years ago
items.summary: With K.A. Sengottaiyan recently setting a 10-day deadline for the AIADMK to initiate the process of bringing all members of the Dravidian major back to the organisation, there has been a renewed interest among sections of political leaders and journalists in Su. Thirunavukkarasar’s revolt in 1997

items.title: Trump issues rare rebuke to Netanyahu over Qatar strikes
items.summary: Donald Trump said he was not notified in advance of the Israeli attack on Qatar, a crucial broker in the negotiations between Israel and Hamas on ending the Gaza war.

items.title: Trump says India, U.S. continue trade talks, expects to speak with ‘dear friend’ Modi soon
items.summary: The U.S. President’s comments signal a significant thaw in bilateral relations as ties between the two countries reeled under possibly the worst phase in over two decades amid tensions over tariffs

items.title: Morning Digest: C.P. Radhakrishnan wins V-P elections, says, ‘Victory of nationalist ideology’; Nepal Army to take charge of security after K.P. Sharma Oli resigns, and more
items.summary: Here is a select list of stories to start the day

items.title: Tamil Nadu’s tryst with horizontal reservation for college students
items.summary: The Kalaiyarasan Commission had observed that students from government schools are disadvantaged compared to those in private schools “due to a cognitive gap created by socio-economic factors such as caste, wealth, parental occupation, parental education, gender etc.”

items.title: Invoking City Improvement Trust’s legacy to oppose renaming of street in Chennai
items.summary: Around 50 residents got together and said that the decision to rename 5th Trust Cross Street goes against the naming convention followed in their area, where Trust Cross Streets numbering 1 to 14 exist. Moreover, they said, the existing name is a silent tribute to the CIT that developed the entire l

items.title: Kidnapped academic Elizabeth Tsurkov released in Iraq
items.summary: The former captive’s sister, Emma Tsurkov, thanked Trump, his special envoy Adam Boehler, the U.S. embassy in Baghdad and the non-profit group Global Reach for their roles in securing the release

items.title: Commuters irked over fourth line affecting frequency of MRTS, suburban train services
items.summary: They say while the project has helped ease long-distance train traffic congestion, it has also led to the cancellation of multi-sectoral services to Gummidipoondi, Avadi, and Arakkonam

items.title: 91.65 lakh Maharashtra farmers receive ₹1,892.61 crore under Namo Shetkari Yojana
items.summary: In this seventh instalment, the subsidy for the period from April 2025 to July 2025 was given to the beneficiaries

items.title: Odisha Crime Branch files charge-sheet in self-immolation by girl on college campus
items.summary: The 504-page chargesheet containing elaboration on the incidents leading to self-immolation by the girls was filed before the court of sub-divisional judicial magistrate in Balasore

items.title: NCP Minister Chhagan Bhujbal writes to government, asks for clarity on Maratha GR
items.summary: Chhagan Bhujbal also objected to the term “kul”, saying it is not a defined term, and may have family, communal, or geographic extension

items.title: Lalu Prasad performs pind-daan at Vishnupad temple in Gaya ji
items.summary: Leader of Opposition in Bihar Legislative Assembly Tejashwi Yadav said that his father’s health was not well despite that he wanted to visit Vishnupad temple to perform ‘pind-daan’ for the salvation of his ancestors’ souls.

items.title: Assam Cabinet approves SOP under Immigrants Expulsion Act
items.summary: The standard operating procedure is aimed at guiding the District Commissioners and Senior Superintendents of Police to expel illegal immigrants from Assam, Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said

items.title: In a first, Indian Armed Forces’ all-women sailing team to circumnavigate the globe
items.summary: The expedition will include crossing the equator twice and rounding the three Great Capes, i.e. Cape Leeuwin in Australia, Cape Horn in South America and the Cape of Good Hope in South Africa.

items.title: Bombay High Court rejects Rajan Vichare’s plea against Naresh Mhaske’s Lok Sabha victory
items.summary: Bombay High Court dismissed Shiv Sena (UBT) MP Rajan Vichare’s plea challenging Naresh Mhaske’s 2024 Lok Sabha victory, ruling that his election affidavit was valid and that disclosure of conviction was unnecessary as Mhaske faced no imprisonment.

items.title: KMRL to pause piling work; KWA to relocate pipes to solve frequent pipe bursts
Indian academia in times of genocide
items.summary: It is our duty, as academics and scientists, to do everything in our power to put pressure on the Israeli government to change its policy.

items.title: ‘This is a national movement now, not just Gen Z’: Nepali protester
items.summary: Many of the Gen Z protesters were themselves caught off guard. Their demand was the resignation of the Prime Minister and Home Minister, as well as addressing the issue of rampant corruption, along with the lifting of the ban on certain social media platforms

items.title: Nato scrambles jets as Russian drones threaten Polish airspace in Ukraine attack
items.summary: Russian attacks target western Ukrainian areas close to the border with Poland, a Nato country.

items.title: Union government seeks ‘factual report’ on forest rights complaint concerning Nicobar project
items.summary: Tribal Affairs Ministry has written to the Chief Secretary of Andaman and Nicobar Islands seeking report on a complaint that the administration falsely certified completing identification and settlement of forest rights

items.title: Why are young people protesting in Nepal and what are their demands?
items.summary: Protests in Nepal turned  deadly after thousands of youngsters marched against the blocking of social media platforms.

items.title: Rajasthan Assembly passes ‘anti-conversion’ Bill with steep penalties
items.summary: It contains the provisions for life imprisonment and fines up to ₹1 crore; will help in maintaining ‘peace and harmony’ in the society, says MoS (Home); Cong. boycotts debate, stages a walkout

items.title: More children are obese than underweight, says Unicef

items.title: SPCA lacks teeth, needs enforcement powers to rein in errant cops
items.summary: Though it has been constituted under  Section 110 of the Kerala Police Act for examining complaints against police officers of and up to the said rank of Deputy Superintendent of Police, it lacks enforcement measures. Chairman says without such powers, SPCA can only recommend action

items.title: Watch: The rise and fall of K.P. Sharma Oli: Nepal’s embattled leader
items.summary: K.P. Sharma Oli’s political journey has ended in resignation after massive anti-corruption protests engulfed Nepal. Once a dominant figure in Nepali politics, Oli faced growing public anger as demonstrators torched his residence, Parliament, and key institutions.

items.title: Contactless card payments could become unlimited and £100 cap scrapped
items.summary: Card providers would be allowed to set their own contactless card payment limit, under the regulator's plans.

items.summary: The communique from the poll panel also noted that under the Representation of People Act, 1950, Aadhaar is already one of the documents listed for the purpose of establishing the identity of a person

items.title: INDIA gathers flock for poll, but fails to keep it together during V-P poll
items.summary: NDA gets 13 votes more than its strength in two Houses, suggesting crossvoting; Opposition claims that out of 315 votes it expected, 300 were cast for its candidate, while 15 votes were invalidated

items.title: Jagan betrayed farmers, says TDP State president

items.summary: Erdogan's critics claim that he has become a latter-day Sultan, dismantling human rights, cracking down on dissent and weaponising the courts.

items.title: Approving China 'mega' embassy would be unlawful, UK government told
items.summary: Opponents are battling China's plan for a mega embassy in London's historic Royal Mint Court.

items.title: British racing on strike - what's the background?
items.summary: British horse racing is staging a one-day strike on Wednesday over a proposed rise in betting taxes.

items.title: What do we know about alleged Trump signature on Epstein letter?
items.summary: An image of a "birthday letter" to Jeffrey Epstein, allegedly signed by Donald Trump, has been released - but the White House says it is a fake.

items.title: Assam doctor asked to explain 21 C-sections in 10 hours
items.summary: Senior gynaecologist Kantheswar Bordoloi said a single caesarean takes 15-25 minutes, depending on the degree of complication

items.title: Actor Karisma Kapoor’s children move Delhi HC for share in late father’s property
items.summary: The plaintiff submits that the purported will allegedly executed by their father ‘is not a legal and valid document, is forged and fabricated and in any event surrounded by suspicious circumstances’

items.title: Finest England night leaves Tuchel with selection dilemmas
items.summary: England thrash Serbia 5-0 to give Thomas Tuchel his best night since he took charge - but that comes with big selection decisions, says chief football writer Phil McNulty.

items.title: Army Chief stresses the need for technological edge to stay ahead of rivals
items.summary: The goalposts will keep changing. Because it is not only me, it is the adversary that is also enhancing his technology. I need to make sure my technological level is ready to beat its impact
